title: Man, 20, dies after 'being stabbed by boy, 17' in southeast London
text:
A 20-year-old man has died after being 'stabbed in the chest' in south east London.

Officers were called to reports of a fight on Barnehurst Avenue, Bexley at 2.48pm, where they found the man with a stab wound.

He was rushed to hospital in east London, but was confirmed to have died at 5.27pm.

Formal identification has yet to be conducted but his family has been informed, police said.

Forensic scientists were spotted taking evidence from the scene tonight beside a car crash, although it is not known if this is related to the stabbing.

A 20-year-old man has died after being 'stabbed in the chest' in broad daylight in south east London, becoming the 119th murder in the capital this year

A 17-year-old boy was arrested on suspicion of attempted murder in connection to the incident and taken into custody.

A spokesman for Scotland Yard said: 'A 20-year-old man was found suffering from a stab injury to his chest. He was taken to an east London hospital, where he died at 17:27hrs.

'His next of kin are aware. Formal identification awaits. A post-mortem examination will be held in due course.'

Forensic scientists were spotted taking evidence from the scene tonight beside a car crash, although it is not known if this is related to the stabbing

A spokesman for Scotland Yard said: 'A 20-year-old man was found suffering from a stab injury to his chest. He was taken to an east London hospital, where he died at 17:27hrs'

The death marks the 119th murder in the capital this year, after two deaths on Thursday and a spate of three killings within 24 hours in late September.

Earlier today police rushed to a butchers in Tottenham following reports of a double stabbing.

Officers and London Ambulance Service arrived at West Green Halal Meat and Groceries store on West Green Road to find two males aged 40 and 29 suffering from stab injuries, and a third male having been assaulted.

Earlier today officers were called to a butchers on West Green Road, in Tottenham, at 9.35am and found two men stabbed, and a third having been assaulted

Two men have been rushed to hospital after a double stabbing in a butcher's shop in a broad daylight in north London

The injured men were taken to hospital but were not deemed to be in life-threatening conditions and no arrests were made.

An investigation into the stabbing in Bexley continues.

Anyone who has information that could assist police is asked to call 101 ref CAD 4418/13 Oct.
description: The unnamed 20-year-old was found with stab wounds on Barnehurst Avenue, Bexley by police following reports of a fight breaking out. He was taken to hospital but later died.
